intro: Quinchamalium patagonicum, commonly known as the Patagonian quinchamalium, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
